bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>üêõ Bug</denchmark-h>
When a suffix is added to checkpoints, the last n checkpoints aren't retained when keeping last N checkpoints. <denchmark-h:h3>To Reproduce</denchmark-h>
Steps to reproduce the behavior (always include the command you ran):
fairseq-train pretrain-data-bin \ --source-lang $SRC --target-lang $TGT \ --clip-norm 0.1 --dropout 0.2 --max-tokens 4096 \ --optimizer adam --adam-betas '(0.9, 0.98)' --clip-norm 0.0 \ --lr 0.0005 --lr-scheduler inverse_sqrt \ --label-smoothing 0.1 \ --warmup-init-lr 1e-7 \ --checkpoint-suffix "$SLURM_JOB_ID" \ --warmup-updates 4000 \ --criterion label_smoothed_cross_entropy \ --save-dir "checkpoints-$SLURM_JOB_ID" \ --arch transformer \ --no-epoch-checkpoints \ --keep-last-epochs 10 \ --max-epoch 100 \ --num-workers 8 \ --skip-invalid-size-inputs-valid-test \ --ddp-backend no_c10d \ --tensorboard-logdir "logdir-$SLURM_JOB_ID" <denchmark-h:h3>Expected behavior</denchmark-h>
I expect the suffix to be resuffixed with the epoch number and to be trained according to <denchmark-link:https://github.com/pytorch/fairseq/blob/145bc9de1278414812b2aef837be9ca0e9c1aebc/fairseq/checkpoint_utils.py#L216>checkpoint_paths</denchmark-link> . <denchmark-h:h3>Environment</denchmark-h>
fairseq Version (e.g., 1.0 or master): 5d88d37 PyTorch Version (e.g., 1.0) 1.5.1 OS (e.g., Linux): Linux How you installed fairseq (pip, source): source Build command you used (if compiling from source): n/a Python version: 3.6.8 CUDA/cuDNN version: N/A GPU models and configuration: N/A Any other relevant information: N/A
